duties_responsibilities.duty: Installing, troubleshooting, and maintaining servers and devices in a lab environment.
Identifying and escalating opportunities for efficiency and effectiveness improvements within the client's infrastructure.
Screening for technical capabilities and recommending hire of long-term resources.
Assisting in the onboarding and training of new hires.
Ensuring local execution of key deliverables and metrics.
Performing root cause analysis of complex technical issues and driving resolution.
Leading hardware installation, rack and stack, cabling, and integration tasks.
Debugging hardware, Linux, and Windows OS-related issues using command-line tools and techniques.
Deploying device/system configuration via Linux and Windows OS.
Analyzing data to diagnose systemic issues and providing support to multiple locations within the Bay Area.
Participating in on-call rotation and maintaining an efficient hardware test lab operation.
Helping develop global standards for processes, workflow, and automation roadmaps for data center operations.
Providing cross-functional communication and other relevant tasks as required.
Participating in the on-call/standby rotation schedule and providing on-site support to multiple locations within the Bay Area.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma, IT Degree, or equivalent experience
